knimeNode.name: Atom Signatures
knimeNode.shortDescription: This node allows to generate the signatures describing the neighborhood of a atom in CDK molecules.

fullDescription.intro: This node allows to generate the signatures describing the neighborhood of carbon or hydrogen atoms in CDK molecules. There are two types of signatures available, HOSE codes or atom signatures. If the minimum and maximum height of the signature are not specified, the signatures will be calculated for height 6. If the signature of specified height cannot be calculated, the signature with maximum possible height for that atom will be reported. The first column of the Output table contains the atom IDs. To visualize the atom IDs in the molecule cell go to File > Preferences. In the drop-down list go to KNIME > Chemistry > CDK and then select an option to "show atom numbers for" the atoms you are interested on. In case you change the "Atom number type" after running the node, the atom IDs will only be updated upon reset of the node.
